intro: Facelis retusa subsp. retusa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
